title: BBC Local Live: Essex Wednesday, 2 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: conservative mp john baron says a `` proper plan '' needs to be in place before a bombing campaign is launched in syria .
teenage boy charged over felled rochford christmas tree .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our updates have come to end for the day , but thank you for joining us .
we 'll be back at 18:00 tomorrow with all your latest news , sport , weather and travel for essex .
have a nice evening .

documents.title: watch : proud parents of fallen soldier who had a housing estate named after him
text: the parents of robert foster , who was killed in afghanistan in 2007 , have been telling me how proud they are a harlow housing development has been named in his memory .
author: Gareth George
BBC Look East

documents.title: weather : mostly dry but cloudy tonight and tomorrow
text: it 'll be a cloudy and windy night , but mostly dry and rather mild , especially around colchester and other more built up areas .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
tomorrow 's set to stay cloudy , windy and mild for much of the day .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: essex police to carry out extra ​pre-christmas inspections of shops selling alcohol
text: shops in harlow selling alcohol could be visited by police in the run up to christmas , as the essex force steps up its efforts to protect children and young people from the dangers of underage drinking .
author: Harlow Star

documents.title: travel : northbound a12 one lane closed
text: one lane is closed on the northbound a12 in ingatestone at j13 because of a crash involving four vehicles .
congestion is to the brook street roundabout .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: concern in essex for missing men in mexico
text: experienced travellers dean lucas and adam coleman , both 33 , disappeared nearly two weeks ago .
their van has been found burned out with two bodies inside .
dean 's girlfriend , josie cox , is from gosfield near braintree .
josie has travelled to mexico to raise awareness of the case and is now waiting for information .
josie 's mum , lynne heseltine , is offering support from home .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: headlines : police ram teenager loses appeal carbon monoxide death warning
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at in essex :
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: syria air strikes : essex mp 'no longer undecided '
text: i 've been told that the previously undecided conservative southend west mp , sir david amess , has now decided where he stands on tonight 's syria air strike vote .
mps have been debating bombing so-called islamic state targets since 11:30 this morning , ahead of a vote tonight .
although confirming sir david had made up his mind , his office were n't prepared to tell me which way he will vote .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: teenager loses ramming police motorcyclist sentence appeal
text: a grays teenager who was jailed in may for ramming a police motorcyclist and trying to run him over during a 130mph pursuit has lost his appeal against his sentence .
martin galbraith , 19 , of boscomb avenue , was jailed for six years after hitting pc paul hill 's bike in a bmw on the a13 in january .
nobody was hurt .
galbraith 's lawyers argued the sentence was too harsh for someone so young , but judges said it was an offence which should be `` discouraged with a severe sentence '' .
author: Ian Puckey
BBC Essex

documents.title: father diagnosed with cancer thanks son who donated part of his liver
text: naresh aggarwal , from southend , was diagnosed with liver cancer last year and was told his chances of surviving were slim .
however , after his son deraj was told by doctors he could donate part of his liver to his father , that 's exactly what he did .
today , mr aggarwal has thanked his son for saving his life .

documents.title: harlow housing development named after fallen soldier
text: i 'm at the opening of a harlow housing development that has been named in memory of an essex soldier who was killed in afghanistan .
robert foster , who died in 2007 , served in the royal anglian regiment first battalion .
the development of four two-bedroom council homes on momples road will be named foster court .
author: Gareth George
BBC Look East

documents.title: carbon monoxide warning after person dies
text: essex fire and rescue is warning people about the dangers of carbon monoxide poisoning , after a death in witham last week .
crews were called to hemingway road on 23 november following a suspected leak .
one person was injured , another died from suspected carbon monoxide poisoning .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: isis , isil , is or daesh ? one group , many names
text: if you 've been following the syria air strike debate today , you may be confused as to why one jihadist group is referred to in so many ways , from isis or is to daesh .
monitoring has been looking into the reasons why .
author: BBC Monitoring

documents.title: hatton garden raiders 'must have had inside information '
text: whoever stole valuables worth £ 14m from a hatton garden vault must have had `` detailed inside information '' , a security guard who worked in the building has told a court .
kelvin stockwell , who worked in the building for more than 20 years , agreed to a suggestion from the defence that it was an inside job at woolwich crown court today .
jon harbinson , 42 , of beresford gardens , benfleet , is among four men who deny conspiracy to commit burglary .
another four men have already pleaded guilty .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: preparations begin for the essex sports awards
text: the 2015 essex sports awards take place tonight .
three people are vying for the prize of essex sports personality of the year :
the ceremony will be broadcast live from colchester united 's community stadium from 19:00 on bbc essex .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: watch : john baron on syria air strikes
text: conservative mp for basildon and billericay , john baron , who is opposing air strikes in syria has been speaking to daily politics ahead of a commons vote later today .
author: The Daily Politics

documents.title: cafe owner praises have-a-go heroes who used water tanker to control generator fire
text: a cafe owner has praised two have-a-go heroes who averted disaster on the a12 by dousing down a fire with their water tanker .
author: Braintree & Witham Times

documents.title: weather : this afternoon will stay fairly cloudy and windy , but also mild
text: it 'll remain often cloudy through the rest of today , though some brighter spells may break through the cloud .
it will be windy but also mild .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: braintree mum 's hopes for missing mexico man
text: the braintree mother of a woman whose boyfriend has been missing in mexico for two weeks says she hopes he will be found in time for christmas .
dean lucas and his friend adam coleman were on a surfing trip when they disappeared .
their van was found burned out with two bodies inside , however the remains have n't yet been identified .
lynne heseltine 's daughter has now flown to mexico trying to help with the inquiry : `` i 'm hoping they are both back for christmas , '' she said .
`` that 's what i want more than anything . ''
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: headlines : syria bombing campaign 'lacks strategy ' and wayne brown appointed colchester caretaker manager
text: here are your top stories for essex this lunchtime :
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: syria air strikes : essex mp raises concerns over 'lack of strategy ' to prime minister
text: the conservative mp for basildon and billericay has told david cameron the uk 's involvement in syria air strikes lacks a `` comprehensive strategy '' .
john baron , who is opposed to military action in syria , put the point to the prime minster during an ongoing commons debate this afternoon .
mr cameron contends there is a strategy and stresses that air strikes are `` only one part '' of it .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: facebook appeal man from basildon is arrested
text: a man who featured in a facebook appeal after he was accused of breaching a harassment order has been arrested by essex police .
bradley cooper , 21 , of basildon , was taken into custody on tuesday .
he is currently being held on sus of breaching a restraining order and making threats to kill .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: streetlights kept on over festive period
text: streetlights are staying on all night across essex for two days this christmas , it has been announced .
essex county council says the lights will be kept on in the early hours of christmas day and new year 's day to help local businesses and residents enjoy celebrations .
part night lighting usually operates across most of essex seven days a week , between 01:00 and 05:00 .
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: colchester chairman on caretaker manager appointment
text: the chairman of colchester united says he hopes supporters will `` get behind '' their new caretaker manager wayne brown .
the former u 's defender will be assisted by john mcgreal following the departure of tony humes last week .
robbie cowling said the pair would be in charge while he and other board members `` determine the next full-time management team '' .
author: Glenn Speller
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: syria air strikes debate due to start
text: essex mps are joining peers from across the country today to debate suggested air strikes in syria , ahead of a vote at about 22:00 .
the government motion to be voted on specifically authorises air strikes `` exclusively '' against the so-called islamic state in syria - but it rules out british troops on the ground .
ahead of the vote , here are some of the key questions answered .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cat in court 'ground-breaking '
text: a psychologist has branded a judge 's decision to allow a pet cat to accompany a defendant at an essex court as `` ground-breaking '' .
the moggy was said to provide `` emotional support '' to the 72-year-old man , who was facing charges of two counts of stalking at chelmsford crown court yesterday .
psychologist dr liz spruin said the decision was `` very unusual '' and a pet being in allowed into a uk court is something that had `` never happened before '' .
author: Jenni Hulse
BBC Essex

documents.title: colchester united appoint wayne brown as caretaker manager
text: colchester united say they have installed wayne brown as caretaker manager .
the former u 's defender will be assisted by john mcgreal while decisions are made on a permanent appointment .
it comes almost a week after the club parted company with tony humes by mutual consent .
author: Glenn Speller
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: essex cricket fixture list unveiled
text: essex have just published their full fixture list for the 2016 domestic cricket season .
the club announced the opening fixtures yesterday , but have now released details for every match .
they start at home to gloucestershire in the county championship .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: james cleverly to back syria air strikes
text: the conservative mp for braintree has been explaining why he will vote for air strikes in syria .
the idea that islamic terrorists wo n't attack us even though we 're attacking them in iraq , but will attack us if we start attacking syria , is frankly naive beyond belief . ''

documents.title: whitlock on sports personality of the year nomination
text: basildon-based gymnast max whitlock hopes his nomination for the bbc sports personality of the year will boost the sport 's profile .
whitlock , who was crowned pommel horse world champion in october , is in the 12-person shortlist for the awards in belfast later this month .
`` the nomination is really important for gymnastics as a whole , getting it acknowledged more is a great feeling , '' he said .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: round-up of essex mps on syrian air strikes
text: here is a run down of how our 18 essex mps are expected to vote on the uk 's involvement in syrian air strikes later today :
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: charity shop thieves cause £ 700 of damage
text: the manager of a grays charity shop told me it 'll cost up to £ 700 to repair damage caused by thieves .
it 's thought the salvation army shop on orsett road was targeted in the early hours of yesterday morning .
shop manager peter brown said : `` they must be desperate because we do n't have much for them to take , so they 're wasting their time . ''
author: Robby West
BBC Essex

documents.title: in case you missed it : judge allows cat to attend court
text: a pet cat has accompanied a man at chelmsford crown court , after a judge gave permission for it to appear .
the moggy named taylor sat alongside its owner , who has been charged with two counts of stalking .
judge charles gratwicke said the 72-year-old defendant , from chelmsford , was `` emotionally supported '' by the animal .

documents.title: £ 2,700 raised in memory of kelly pearce
text: a fundraising appeal set up to support the family of a canvey mum who was stabbed to death has raised more than £ 2,700 in just 10 days .
author: Southend Echo

documents.title: essex mp wants 'proper plan ' before backing syrian air strikes
text: the only one of 18 essex mps who has said he will vote against air strikes in syria has been telling us his reasons why .
conservative john baron , who represents basildon and billericay , says he wants a `` proper plan '' in place before bombing the so-called islamic state in syria .
`` at a time when there are already too many war planes chasing too few targets in syria , i think we risk making the same sort of error we made in iraq '' , mr baron said .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: weather : rather cloudy , but remaining windy and mild
text: it will be a rather cloudy day for many of us , with a little drizzly rain in places .
however , a few brighter spells may break through the cloud at times , mainly this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: teenage boy charged over felled rochford christmas tree
text: a 15-year-old boy has been charged with criminal damage after a christmas tree in rochford was cut down over the weekend .
the teenager was arrested yesterday over the incident in the town 's market square .
the boy was taken to rayleigh police station for questioning before being charged with the offence .
he has since been bailed .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : teenager charged over felled rochford christmas tree and essex mps to vote on syrian air strikes
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: welcome to wednesday 's live page for essex
text: good morning .
welcome to the local live page for essex .
until 18:00 the news team and i will bring you all the latest stories for the county .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email us , tweet us , or visit our facebook page .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live
